rationale: The paper presents a technically coherent and implementation-useful search architecture (LLM-guided MCTS with FSA) and reports strong in-scope gains, but evidence is not yet sufficient for unrestricted production deployment due to limited uncertainty reporting, incomplete reproducibility packaging, and execution realism gaps.
rejection_reasons: Reject immediate full live deployment because key result uncertainty (confidence intervals/significance/multi-seed variance) is not adequately reported.
Reject direct production rollout because deterministic reproducibility artifacts are incomplete for strict audit replay.
Reject unconstrained execution because robustness under stronger slippage/impact and stress-regime assumptions remains under-validated.
recommendations: Implement the architecture in a deterministic research pipeline with immutable run manifests and prompt/config hashes.
Require rolling-window and multi-seed significance validation before promotion.
Add strict risk and cost realism gates (turnover, impact, concentration, drift alarms) before any live usage.
Use paper-trading/shadow deployment as the default operating mode until all gates pass.
follow_up_actions: Reproduce core benchmark tables with fixed seeds and publish variance bands.
Run transaction-cost and slippage sensitivity sweeps with stress scenarios.
Add blinded human interpretability evaluation to reduce evaluator circularity.
Verify cross-market stability with longer and more recent out-of-sample windows.
